MajorClaims.Text: it is necessary for us to be extraordinarily cautious
it might not be the most beneficial move to our society

Claims.Text: rough work is intolerable when we want to stay competitive
we need to catch up with the pace of the world
fast pace may be the wise move to correspond with today's world
even when the world operates in fast pace, it still requires accuracy
Even when we managed to keep up with the pace by neglecting the details of a project and only aim for a general frame of the project, this will not be something satisfy for the company and clients
Some work cannot tolerate any mistakes at all

Premises.Text: Even simple issues in our daily life like homework require accuracy
If we rush through the work by taking risk of making mistakes, we are actually making zero effort going through our study roughly only for the purpose of fill in before the deadline
it only fulfills the work itself which is rather worthless
It is our capability of work that we should improve rather than holding the belief in completing it
it may take time to keep up with the others if w need to review our work multiple times
with consistent work soon enough we'll be able to bring up our speed in completion of work
We soon will be out of the picture even when we kept up with the pace
when the problem reveals itself we'll have to go back and fix the mistakes we have made
This might be even more costly and time consuming than a neat completion of work at the start
other than the importance of accuracy, the world also seeks efficiency, which concludes both minimum time completion and also criterion of quality
A miscalculation of the orbit in launching rocket may lead to a failure of the whole project which might worth trillions of dollars
even when the scientists want to finish off quickly, but they couldn't miss even a single part of the mission since it may trigger loads of problems
in official missions like the work done by NASA, a tiny mistake can be catastrophic
